item.title: 美国财政部出售美元使比索保持在阿根廷外汇区间内
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，随着比索接近交易区间的上限，美国财政部周二再次通过桑坦德银行在阿根廷货币市场抛售美元。【原文：The US Treasury sold dollars again on Tuesday through Banco Santander in Argentina’s currency market as the peso neared the ceiling of its trading band, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 为什么黄金在不确定时期具有如此大的吸引力？
item.description: 几个世纪以来，黄金一直是政治和经济不稳定时期的避风港资产。黄金作为一种可靠的高价值商品，可以方便地运输并在任何地方出售，当其他一切都处于动荡之中时，黄金给人一种安全感。【原文：For centuries, gold has been the go-to haven asset in times of political and economic uncertainty. Its status as a reliably high-value commodity that can be transported easily and sold anywhere offers a sense of safety when everything else is in turmoil.】

item.title: 苹果计划推出配备 18 英寸屏幕的可折叠 iPad，但开发工作受阻
item.description: 苹果公司通过增加一个巨大的可折叠屏幕来重塑 iPad 的努力遇到了开发障碍，可能会推迟计划中的上市时间。【原文：Apple Inc.’s effort to reinvent the iPad by adding a giant foldable screen has hit development hurdles, potentially delaying the planned launch.】

item.title: First Brands 创始人遭保安起诉，要求支付加班费
item.description: First Brands 创始人帕特里克-詹姆斯（Patrick James）被两名私人保安起诉，他们声称在为这家破产汽车供应商最近离职的首席执行官提供人身保护时，被错误地拒绝支付加班费。【原文：First Brands founder Patrick James has been sued by two private security guards who claim they were wrongly denied overtime pay while providing personal protection to the bankrupt auto supplier’s recently departed chief executive officer.】

item.title: 微软免除许多销售人员返回办公室的义务
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）将免除许多销售职位的重返办公室任务，提供了比许多科技行业同行更灵活的方法。【原文：Microsoft Corp. will exempt many sales roles from its coming return-to-office mandate, offering a more flexible approach than many of its tech industry peers.】

item.title: 中国称荷兰 Nexperia 公司遭扣押供应链面临风险
item.description: 中国商务部长警告说，荷兰政府控制中资芯片制造商耐克斯派瑞亚公司的举动 "严重影响 "了全球供应链的稳定。【原文：China’s Commerce Minister warned that the Dutch state’s move to take control of Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia has “seriously affected” the stability of the global supply chain.】

item.title: 斯托纳拉斯：欧洲央行实现了经济软着陆和复苏
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）表示，欧洲中央银行在保持经济韧性的同时，将通胀率恢复到了 2%，实现了 "软着陆"。【原文：The European Central Bank pulled off a “soft landing” by returning inflation to 2% while maintaining economic resilience, Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras said.】

item.title: CDS 小组呼吁外部帮助决定阿达赫赔付事宜
item.description: 一个负责监督信用违约掉期市场的小组正在寻求外部帮助，以决定阿达赫公司与其债权人最近达成的债务协议是否应触发保险赔付。【原文：A panel overseeing the credit default swaps market is asking for external help to decide whether a recent debt deal between Ardagh and its creditors should trigger a payout of the insurance.】

item.title: OpenAI 将通过新的 ChatGPT Atlas 浏览器挑战谷歌
item.description: OpenAI即将推出其首款人工智能驱动的网络浏览器，这将使这家ChatGPT制造商与Alphabet公司旗下的谷歌在新的领域展开竞争。【原文：OpenAI is set to unveil its first artificial intelligence-powered web browser, putting the ChatGPT maker in competition on a new front with Alphabet Inc.’s Google.】

item.title: 加密货币风险胃口下降，阿尔特币跌破 FTX 后低点
item.description: 在近 200 亿美元的抛售引发该行业历史上最大的单日洗盘后不到两周，加密货币市场陷入了清算后的困境。【原文：The crypto market is stuck in post-liquidation limbo less than two weeks after a nearly $20 billion selloff triggered the largest single-day washout in the industry’s history.】

item.title: 美国将购买 100 万桶战略石油储备
item.description: 特朗普政府计划为美国战略石油储备购买 100 万桶石油，利用低油价开始填补枯竭的储备。【原文：The Trump administration plans to buy 1 million barrels for the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve, taking advantage of low oil prices to begin filling the depleted stockpile.】

item.title: 巴里克被查封的马里金矿在国家管理下重新启动
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，巴里克矿业公司（Barrick Mining Corp.）在马里的大型金矿在 6 月份由国家管理者接管后，九个多月来首次重新开始运营。【原文：Operations restarted at Barrick Mining Corp.’s massive gold mine in Mali for the first time in more than nine months, after a state administrator took over the asset in June, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 谷歌 "月神工厂 "将对里约数据中心电网进行审查
item.description: 据里约热内卢市副市长称，Alphabet 公司的谷歌探月工厂计划在里约热内卢建设潜在的数据中心之前对该市的电网进行审查，这些数据中心将使里约热内卢成为拉丁美洲人工智能产业的前沿。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google moonshot factory plans to review Rio de Janeiro’s power grid ahead of the potential construction of data centers that would put the city at the forefront of Latin America’s artificial-intelligence industry, according to the city’s vice mayor.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利警告私人信贷将回响金融危机
item.description: 英格兰银行警告说，1.7 万亿美元的私人信贷繁荣与次贷危机有相似之处，因为英国官员确认了让市场接受压力测试的计划。【原文：The Bank of England warned of parallels between the $1.7 trillion private credit boom and the subprime debt crisis, as UK officials confirmed plans to subject the market to stress tests.】

item.title: 十年衰退后，自由全球出让一半 ITV 股份
item.description: 自由全球有限公司（Liberty Global Ltd.）提出出售其所持 ITV Plc 股份的一半，这使其持有十多年的股份亏损具体化。【原文：Liberty Global Ltd. offered to sell half of its shares in ITV Plc, crystallizing a loss in the stake it has held for more than a decade.】

item.title: 奢侈品需求改善，欧莱雅中国销售额回升
item.description: 受高端产品需求的拉动，欧莱雅在包括中国在内的地区的销售额在第三季度实现了正增长。【原文：L’Oréal’s sales growth in the region that includes China turned positive in the third quarter, lifted by demand for its high-end products.】

item.title: 国债上涨，美国停摆已进入第四个星期
item.description: 在英国和加拿大债券市场出现类似价格走势，以及美国政府关门即将成为有记录以来第二长的情况下，国债收益率上升，30 年期国债收益率达到 4 月初以来的最低水平。【原文：Treasuries gained, with the 30-year yield reaching the lowest level since early April, amid similar price action in the UK and Canadian bond markets and a US government shutdown on the verge of becoming the second-longest on record.】

item.title: 黄金暴跌，通胀加速，加拿大股市下跌
item.description: 周二，加拿大股票基准指数下跌，表现逊于美国股票基准指数，原因是该国通胀速度超出预期，同时金价下跌对采矿业造成了压力。【原文：Canada’s stocks benchmark tumbled Tuesday, underperforming its US counterpart as inflation in the country quickened more than expected while falling gold prices weighed on the mining sector.】

item.title: 卢拉计划对银行和博彩业征税以缓解财政困难
item.description: 一位熟悉情况的人士说，巴西政府正在最后敲定对高收入者、一些金融机构和在线博彩业增税的计划，因为在国会一项关键的财政措施失败后，政府正试图增加收入并支撑国家的预算前景。【原文：Brazil’s government is finalizing plans to seek tax increases on high-income earners, some financial institutions and online betting, a person familiar with the situation said, as it attempts to raise revenues and shore up the country’s budget outlook after the defeat of a key fiscal measure in Congress.】

item.title: 世界名人网称打击犯罪的堡垒 "参差不齐
item.description: Worldline SA 称，在对欺诈行为视而不见的指控进行审查后发现，整个公司的反金融犯罪控制措施执行情况 "参差不齐"。【原文：Worldline SA said a review following allegations it had turned a blind eye to fraud discovered “uneven” implementation of anti-financial crime controls across the company.】

item.title: 成为明星证人的前阿尔切戈斯首席交易员避免了牢狱之灾
item.description: 前 Archegos 资本管理公司首席交易员威廉-富田（William Tomita）成为控方指控前老板比尔-黄（Bill Hwang）的明星证人，但因其在 2021 年公司倒闭中所扮演的角色而免于监禁。【原文：Former Archegos Capital Management head trader William Tomita, who became a star prosecution witness against ex-boss Bill Hwang, was spared a prison term for his role in the firm’s 2021 collapse.】

item.title: 石油贸易集团改变对扩大乙醇销售法案的立场
item.description: 美国石油学会告诉联邦立法者，它反对通过立法扩大乙醇混合燃料的销售，这对石油和天然气贸易组织来说是一个逆转。【原文：The American Petroleum Institute told federal lawmakers that it opposes legislation expanding sales of fuels with higher ethanol blends, a reversal for the oil and gas trade group.】

item.title: 埃及将购买更多石油产品以腾出天然气用于液化天然气出口
item.description: 埃及正在实施一项购买更多石油产品用于发电的计划，因为这个资金短缺的北非国家正在腾出天然气用于液化天然气出口，这也是埃及偿还拖欠外国运营商款项的努力的一部分。【原文：Egypt is embarking on a plan to buy more oil products for power generation as the cash-strapped North African nation frees up gas for LNG exports, as part of efforts to repay money it owes to foreign operators.】

item.title: 受特朗普税收法案推动，嘉吉公司利润激增 86
item.description: 嘉吉公司第一季度利润激增 86%，因为这家美国最大的私营公司受益于唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收法案，而且其所有业务部门都取得了较好的业绩。【原文：Cargill Inc.’s profit surged 86% in the first quarter as the largest private company in the US benefited from President Donald Trump’s tax bill and better performance in all its business segments.】

item.title: 花旗、巴克莱等银行主导 Hologic 120 亿美元债务交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Citigroup Inc., Barclays Plc and Bank of America Corp. are among banks providing $12.25 billion of debt financing to support Blackstone Inc. and TPG Inc.’s acquisition of medical device-maker Hologic Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 热带风暴梅利莎有可能引发加勒比洪灾
item.description: 热带风暴 "梅利莎 "已在加勒比海形成，并有可能在整个周末带来危险的洪水和山体滑坡。【原文：Tropical Storm Melissa has formed in the Caribbean Sea, where it threatens to bring dangerous flooding and landslides through the weekend.】

item.title: 威廉斯堡殖民地通过出售债券进入应税债券市场
item.description: 自称为世界上最大的活历史博物馆的威廉斯堡殖民地即将进入市政债券市场，进行首次公开债券销售。【原文：Colonial Williamsburg, which describes itself as the world’s largest living history museum, is coming to the municipal-bond market for its first public bond sale.】

item.title: 普渡大学债权人投票支持 74 亿美元计划以结束破产
item.description: 普渡制药公司（Purdue Pharma）的债权人投票赞成这家阿片类药物制造商退出破产程序，并向那些声称受到该公司成瘾性止痛药伤害的社区和个人支付数十亿美元的提议。【原文：Creditors of Purdue Pharma voted in favor of the opioid maker’s proposal to exit bankruptcy and pay billions to communities and individuals who say they were harmed by the company’s addictive painkillers.】

item.title: 据说德国零部件供应商博泽正在探索股权出售事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，德国汽车零部件供应商博泽汽车零部件有限公司（Brose Fahrzeugteile SE & Co.【原文：German car parts supplier Brose Fahrzeugteile SE & Co. is considering selling a stake in its business as the industry has been hit hard by rising competition from China and declining car sales, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 金银创 2013 年以来最大跌幅后，黄金矿商大幅下挫
item.description: 在金银价格创下十多年来最大跌幅后，金矿企业的股价暴跌。【原文：Shares of gold miners plummeted after the price of bullion fell the most in more than a decade.】
